I think you'd really enjoy "A Beautiful Mind" (2001) starring Russell Crowe as John Nash, a brilliant mathematician struggling with schizophrenia. It's a powerful and inspiring biopic that explores the human side of genius.

If you're looking for another option, I'd recommend "The Theory of Everything" (2014) featuring Eddie Redmayne as Stephen Hawking, a renowned physicist and cosmologist who defies the odds despite his physical challenges. Both films are critically acclaimed and have won numerous awards, so you can't go wrong with either choice!
